Leaves: Toothed to lobed, with spiny margins, to 30 cm long, green above and white below. Stem leaves are 4-25 cm long and stalkless, forming a wing.
Flowers: Purple, 12-40 mm diameter, with spreading to recurved spines.
FruitSeeds: 3-6 mm long, light brown, smooth, with parachuting hairs 2-3 cm long.
DistinguishingFeatures: Flowerheads wide, solitary or in small clusters versus narrowly cylindric in larger clusters in Perennial thistle (*Cirsium arvense*).
Impacts: Blocks grazing animals reducing land capacity, harbours pests, contaminates hay.

Photos.Caption: Juveniles green and flat if not cold
Fluffy seed on standing dead plants
